attributes.action: Reduce the age of buying beer and alco-pops 5% and under, wine under 13% to 16
attributes.background: We would like the legal age of purchasing certain alcoholic beverages to the age of 16. By reducing the purchasing of beer and wine to 16 there will be less consumption of hard spirits as well as the use of counterfeit identification. This will promote a safer way for children to experiment.
attributes.additional_details: This theory is modelled on many European countries laws; Belgium, Germany and Spain. In 2016, 7,327 people died from alcohol related deaths of which many were caused by excessive drinking of spirits. The countries current legislation promotes the use of spirits for underage teenagers to become intoxicated. So by legalising a safer alternative to consume alcohol, which is an inevitability, there will be a decrease in alcohol related medical conditions in underage teenagers.

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying £50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Increase direct government funding to improve the support for homeless people.
attributes.background: This is a very important issue.
attributes.additional_details: Primary and secondary data.

attributes.action: Legally required rescue insurance cover for adventure sports/outdoor pursuits
attributes.background: Rescue authorities are subjected to very expensive rescue operations which in many cases could have been avoided and are currently financed by the taxpayer. Rescuers are also risking their own safety. Thrill Seekers should meet the costs in the event of their rescue and have to take out insurance.

attributes.action: Give employees the right to sue employers for health and safety breaches
attributes.background: We must return to the earlier system to ensure that employees have the right to sue their employer for health and safety breaches or injuries.
attributes.additional_details: Section 47 of the HASAWA 1974 restrict employee from taking civil proceedings against employer for failure to comply with the health and safety law. This is against the spirit of the health and safety legislation and natural justice. It is also not compatible with access to justice under Human Rights Act 1998.

attributes.action: Ban synthetic pesticides and herbicides
attributes.background: Pesticides and herbicides are poisons that could destroy all living things & have catastrophic consequences for our health. We no longer recognize our country. A third of birds have died in the past 15 years, half of our butterflies. Pollinators are disappearing.
attributes.additional_details:
Read silent spring by Rachel Carson. 
They use glyphosate acid which is suspected to cause cancer, Parkinson's, infertility and birth defects. Several cases of the latter in France. 
Nous voulons des coquelicots in France are trying to get them banned. 
Monsanto, who make glyphosate pesticides, have been sued and lost by users getting cancer through use of their glyphosate pesticides. 
Let's ban them and save our countryside, animals and ourselves.

attributes.action: Support a Referendum to abolish compulsory BBC licence fee
attributes.background: In this age of fair competition the BBC should not be able to unfairly demand a yearly licence payment from the general public without giving the people the choice of having or not having the BBC channels, this is an outdated and unfair monopoly.
attributes.additional_details:
No other media company gets a compulsory payment from the uk general public.
You can choose to have Virgin,Sky etc You have no choice when it comes to the BBC

attributes.action: ABOLISH VAT ON ALL FOOD AND DRINK
attributes.background:
Did you know that in this day and age with food banks in existence the government still collect VAT on basic foods like:

Potato crisps
Biscuits
Ice cream
Chocolate bars
Mineral water
Fizzy drinks
Alcohol free beer and wine
Fruit squash
attributes.additional_details:
This isn’t a time to get all judgemental on whether these food and drinks are unhealthy or not.  People are starving because they can’t afford to eat!

Knocking VAT off the selling price mean that the cost of basic food and drink items could be:

6p for a pack of crisps
1p for a biscuit
10p for a choc ice
2p for 250ml of fizzy drink

Make these high calorie per pence foods more available to reduce malnutrition.  Make your food shopping budget go further.

attributes.action: Legislate a Less Lethal Firearms license for civilians
attributes.background:
A Less Lethal Firearms license should be legislated for civilians to purchase, possess, open carry and use PAVA Spray and/or a Taser.

This should be accompanied by a Firearms Act 2020 amendment with Section 5 exemptions for civilians with a license.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of increasing violent crime and strain on the Police Service, civilians with jobs such as Security Guards, Doormen, Delivery Guards and Neighbourhood Patrol groups should have a lawful right to a low risk form of OCW (Open Carry Weapon) for use in defence, escape and citizens arrests with lower casualty risks when confronted with physical violence.

Security checks and training in correct and lawful use should be mandatory before purchase and ownership of a Taser or PAVA Spray.

attributes.action: Introduce 'on road' Cycling to Driving lessons/Driving Test
attributes.background: Driving Test/Lessons to include 3 Hours (30 minute segments) of on road cycling for those able to do so
attributes.additional_details: Give humans the perspective to see the road from both a driving a car and riding a bicycle

attributes.action: Stop the 4 year back date of repayments for families over child benefit limits
attributes.background:
Petition question: 
"is it morally and ethically right for the government to allow HMRC to demand repayments dating 4 / 5 years previous, from families who received child benefit incorrectly when the rules around the thresholds were only made clear to these families from September 2018".
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of families including mine have just received demands of thousands of pounds from HMRC asking for all benefits paid for the past 4 or 5 years. My salary has always been below the relevant child benefit threshold but with private medical, bonus and company car, this all takes me above all thresholds. How was I to know, HMRC did not clearly advertise this. It feels like it is only when the government need to find more funds for something like the NHS do they decide to tell people so they can claim the millions back.

attributes.action: GCSE Maths, English and Science should be optional from year 10
attributes.background: Many GCSE students will find the knowledge either difficult or pointless as there is so much to remember on top of the pressure from other subjects. Also other students may get bored and distract those who do want to take the subject in future potentially causing them to achieve lower.

attributes.action: Eliminate the effects of the use of single-use plastic in takeaway restaurants.
attributes.background: We are a group of sixth form students who are highly concerned with the use of single-use plastics. This is because it uses fossil fuels, is non- biodegradable and pollutes our oceans resulting in the killing of animals and disruption of food chains.
attributes.additional_details: We are increasingly worried about the future of our planet, with plastic contributing to a huge carbon footprint. We want to eliminate the use of unnecessary plastic in takeaways nationally.

attributes.action: All large Companies should have a Mental Health First Aider in the work place..
attributes.background: Make it mandatory for all large companies that employ more than 10 people to have a mental health first aider in the work place. This would help raise awareness and prevent discrimination to employees who suffer a mental health problem.

attributes.action: Make English Literature an optional subject for GCSE
attributes.background: Many students feel that learning quotations for novels that are outdated and not relevant to today's society is unnecessary and a waste of time, therefore making it an optional subject and replacing it with a lesson dedicated to life skills would prove to be much more useful for the students
attributes.additional_details: English Language should remain as a compulsory subject in the GCSE subject selection while English Literature should be optional as it is not a useful skill in later life. Furthermore, the amount that students are required to learn can be overwhelming for them and also requires significantly more effort relative to other subjects.

attributes.action: Stop Physical Education (PE) from being compulsory from Year 9 to Year 11
attributes.background: We'd like to stop teenagers from having to do physical education due to them being self conscious about their outward appearance and to allow them to focus on their GCSEs.

attributes.action: The School Week Should Start On A Tuesday and End On Friday.
attributes.background: Many people may need that additional rest from school whether they're a student or the teacher.

attributes.action: Sanction Turkey until military action against Kurd groups in Rojava stops
attributes.background: Military action against Kurdish groups in Rojava must end. Turkey's allies should help the Kurds and not fuel the attackers. The UK must impose sanctions on Turkey until they stop military action against Kurdish groups in Rojava.

attributes.action: Allow a (paid) day off for women on their first day of menstruation
attributes.background: On the first day of a women’s period (menstruation), while some only experience bleeding, unfortunately many experience severe additional symptoms. It is a hard, painful and therefore unmotivating day for those starting their monthly period and already causes thousands of women to take time off.
attributes.additional_details:
Many women, as well as heavy bleeding , get additional, sometimes severe, symptoms such as abdominal and back cramping, headaches, muscle and joint pain, sickness, etc. And additional symptoms, like fainting, due to other health problems like anemia.
Menstruation for many women make school/work days almost unbareable, it is extremely stressful and hard to concentrate. Many women already feel the need to take days off or go home due to this, where they can allow their body to rest.

attributes.action: Require the NHS to notify patients whose test results are at risk of delay
attributes.background: There is currently no system in place to notify patients if their results are caught up in a backlog, and from a personal point of view this can lead to great stress and anxiety.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be part of law/the NHS Constitution to notify patients of notable delays as this can cause distress.
 
According to "Standards for the communication of patient diagnostic test results on discharge from hospital" (NHS England, March 2016), the stress and anxiety on a patient in the delay of the results has been acknowledged, and they claimed "reviews" were being carried out.

attributes.action: Affirm that a ban on smacking children will not be enacted in England
attributes.background:
The Scottish Parliament is in the process of introducing a ban on parents smacking their children.

This could influence Parliament to introduce a nationwide ban. 

Parliament must affirm that it will not restrict parents' rights to decide how to raise their children.
attributes.additional_details:
Assaulting your child is already illegal. A ban on smacking will not prevent bad parents beating their children, it will merely criminalise good parents trying to discipline their kids. 

It would also open the floodgates: will sending a child to their room be false imprisonment? Will taking away their toy be theft? 

Children need discipline and it is for parents, not the State, to decide how to do it. A ban would be unacceptable interference in parents' rights to a family life.

attributes.action: Allow 16-year-olds to ride 125cc Scooters/Mopeds
attributes.background: Allowing 16-year-olds to ride 125cc Mopeds would improve lots of areas, firstly, it would reduce traffic on 40mph roads as most 50cc mopeds are limited to 30mph, secondly, it would decrease the amount of tailgating to riders of 50cc mopeds which is dangerous and could cause accidents
attributes.additional_details: For anyone that is unaware about this topic, 16-year-olds can legally ride 50cc Scooters/Mopeds which are limited to around 30mph, but when he/she reaches 17, they can legally ride 125cc which can usually reach around 60mph. Myself and many others believe that 16-year-olds should be allowed to ride 125cc mopeds to help the issues I stated before

attributes.action: Bring Finland’s ‘National Jealousy Day’ to the UK
attributes.background:
In Finland taxes are made public on the same day. Every citizens tax details are released, everyone will be able to see how much tax everyone else is paying. 
An open approach on tax will show tax dodging, the rich/poor gap, reduce gender pay differences, and much more. 
See additional sources.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2018/11/finland-has-just-published-everyone-s-taxes-on-national-jealousy-day/

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for out-of-school groups to have child protection policies
attributes.background: Having worked in a Faith-based organisation myself and being aware of local groups that do not have child protection policies in place, I am concerned about young people who attend such places. When I have personally approached the leaders of such places in good faith, I have been turned away.
attributes.additional_details: Groups, including faith-based groups such as churches and mosques, which run after-school clubs need to be registered on a database and ground rules need to be put in place by a statutory body to help monitor the progress and implementation of basic rights of the young people who attend places of worship and other groups for religious education or other activities. Some groups are not concerned with the bureaucracy of child protection.

attributes.action: Offer free DNA paternity tests after birth as the standard NHS procedure.
attributes.background: Approximately 20% of the men in the UK who get a paternity test turn out not to be fathers of their alleged children. A paternity DNA check should be offered for free at birth. It should also be offered if a mother claims that someone is the father after some time passes since the birth.
attributes.additional_details: Nowadays it is easy, fast and cheap to make a DNA paternity test. If the paternity test results with a negative result, the man should have a choice to avoid any legal/financial responsibility and owe no alimonies whatsoever, unless he consciously chooses to accept the child as his own (whilst being fully aware that it was conceived by someone else).

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of Lee Sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again. No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denying it.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to release Sheikh Ibrahim Zakzaky from prison.
attributes.background:
Ibrahim Yaqoub El Zakzaky, is a Shia cleric who was arrested & imprisoned wrongfully in 2015  is still being detained despite the Federal High Court ordering his release on the 2nd of December 2016. 

As a result of his imprisonment, his health has deteriorated significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of his supporters have been either arrested, abused and even killed for protesting and calling for his release. 

The conditions in which Sheikh Zakzaky has been in are inhumane, and something needs to be done urgently to assist him.

attributes.action: Allow Tier 2 (Intra-Company) individuals and their dependants to settle.
attributes.background: We have lived in the UK for 5 years and are not allowed to settle equally to colleagues on Tier 2 (general). Our parents are paying the same amounts of taxes, and not receiving any government services. It is not currently possible to apply for leave to remain with this visa made after April 2010.
attributes.additional_details: We have a private education and health insurance and aren't incurring expenses from the government. Our employment situation made UK our home, we grew up here and are about to enroll to universities; it is unreasonable to look elsewhere. Our parents are committed to careers in an international company; they will bring back their international earnings to UK to finance our education and settlement. As such, it is a win-win situation that merits consideration

attributes.action: Review how sexual assault victims are treated in court
attributes.background: Sexual assault victims often get ripped apart whilst giving evidence and trying to convict their rapist/the person who sexually assaulted them. This can often damage the victim’s mental health and force them not to come forward and report such things or drop out prior to court.
attributes.additional_details: 80% of sexual assaults are not reported, I believe this is due to the scary court process and being taken through something so horrific. The defence call these victims liars, sluts and retraumatise them all over again. Something needs to change as damaging and destroying a victim of such crime where there is enough evidence to suggest the suspect is guilty to get them off a charge is not the way forward.

attributes.action: M1 motorway must go beyond Berwick upon Tweed
attributes.background: As we now have the M6 motorway on the west coast, going all the way up to the Anglo-Scottish border (i.e. Gretna Green) and then connecting the M74 motorway on the other side of the border, we could now do with having a motorway that goes over the border on the east coast too.
attributes.additional_details: That's why I urge the government to extend the M1 up to Scotland on the east coast as well.  It would mean people travelling from London to Edinburgh or vice-versa would be able to travel not only quicker, but would also reduce traffic on our roads.

attributes.action: Revive the Black Arrow rocket program to put the UK back into space.
attributes.background: From 1969-71, the UK launched a rocket named Black Arrow. The program was a success, but was unfortunately cancelled due to cost issues. Now with new technology and cheaper launch costs, it would be great to see this program revived to provide an alternative launch platform for sattelite companies.
attributes.additional_details: The Black Arrow saw four launches, with one placing the sattelite Prospero into an orbit around the earth. While the rocket saw two launch failures, it eventually ended up succeeding. Unfortunately, the program was cancelled in favour of using the cheaper US rockets to launch sattelites. With the growth of the space industry, and the advent of Brexit, a UK space program is needed. An updated version of Black Arrow will provide a cheaper alternative to the Ariane or Proton rockets used by Europe.

attributes.action: Enable the means to choose whether internet linked activities can be recorded.
attributes.background: I wish a simple, obvious setting to be shown on all devices used to connect to the internet to enable or prevent the harvesting of all data generated from any use of the internet unless required by law. It should be readily accessible to be turned on or off and take immediate effect.
attributes.additional_details: When Google updated it's Terms of Service, I checked what Google had recorded. It had recorded every search I had performed. Worse, the companies I had searched within, sent that data to Google. E.G. if within another company's web-site you click on a Google map, details go to Google. It goes much further. If I use my Android smart phone to take a picture, the software notifies Google! Anything Android processes goes to Google, payments, hotel bookings etc, they get to know everything - why?

attributes.action: Give under 18's free self-test STI kits
attributes.background: Self-test kits for STIs are also available online and on the high street. They include home testing kits for infections such as chlamydia and gonorrhoea that you can send away to a laboratory. This could be a huge help to the amount of people who are nervous or shy to go to such clinic to be tested.

attributes.action: Change student loan arrangements to reflect career success
attributes.background:
The current arrangements reduce the incentive for students to achieve high-earning roles. Successful students see their debt increase every year until they are earning 4 x the average salary. 
Lower earners may never repay anything. This situation cannot be justified.
attributes.additional_details: The interest on the debt should be fixed at the no more than half a percent above the Bank of England rate when the loan is issued. Repayment should then be taken from all earnings/income (with no lower limit) at a rate that would pay the interest charges and reduce the outstanding balance. If students never work then the loan should be collected by a small reduction in any benefits.

attributes.action: Allow 3 wheeled vehicles to be driven on a car licence at 17
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that 3 wheeled vehicles could not be driven on any licence until the person is 21 i can sort off understand this for motorcycle licences but not car licences

attributes.action: Individuals should pay half the amount of tax on overtime.
attributes.background:
In order to better your financial position and that of your family you should be able to pay only half the amount of tax on any hours worked as overtime compared to what you work as normal hours. 
This arrangement would encourage people into work and boost production and productivity for employers.

attributes.action: Ban estate agents from managing family members’ properties.
attributes.background: After 6 years of nothing but stress due to a "estate agent" who was related/family member to my landlord renting a badly maintenanced property to me. I want a law in place to protect people who private rent from being put in my place.
attributes.additional_details:
I want restrictions that stop relatives who are estate agents/letting agents renting out properties to people for family members.
 
Estate agents make money renting a place out so not only do they make a financial gain themselves but for their family this would be disallowed in other professions as conflict of interest. 
This also gives the issue I had the place was in disrepair and the estate agent was the manager disregarded any laws in place to protect me as a Tenant to help his family.

attributes.action: legally require a receipt to be printed only if a customer actually wants one
attributes.background: Many large companies automatically print receipts for customers after small transactions (namely fast food shops and brands offering a self service experience). Customers often do not take these receipts. This is an incredible waste of paper that is not justifiable and can be easily avoided.

attributes.action: Ban strobe lighting to reduce the risks of epileptic seizures.
attributes.background: So many people are forced to turn away, close their eyes or even have others to protect them. It also prevents us to do something that normal people can do e.g. concerts. By banning strobes we would be reducing the risks of seizures and enable us to do something that anyone else could do.
attributes.additional_details: Being an epileptic myself, I know how it feels when we're unable to do something with friends or family, to describe it in anyway possible you feel alone. I would love to be able to do specific things such as concerts or horror mazes without having to wear sunglasses or close my eyes. If a seizure does occur in someone because of strobe lighting it can be fatal (SUDEP) to reduce this risk would be a major step forward. Many kinds of symptoms occur from epilepsy such as memory loss and depression.

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Impose mandatory funeral funding clause upon private pension providers.
attributes.background: When my partner's father passed on, his family struggled to pay the cost of his funeral, in spite of not applying for the funeral funding payout from the job centre, which they were eligible for. We see non-UK nationals work lifelong, only to see their families impoverished by the cost of funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Families of nationals and non-UK nationals that provide an excellent service to the country are often left in a position where they cannot apply for state funeral funding because of the UK benefits system and its applications toward specific situations. Time of death cannot be predicted but private pension pay-ins are lifelong and should fund a funeral, which is the most costly part of some people's lives. The saddest day of one's life should never also be the most internally destructive.

attributes.action: Increase the standard fine and points for driving in closed motorway lanes.
attributes.background: Despite radio ads, we still often see drivers waiting til the very last second to move out of closed lanes with a red X, often passing through a mile or so of warnings. Those caught in the accident and the police/ambulance service are put at risk by the idiocy of people in a hurry.
attributes.additional_details:
The current fines are either not charged, or aren't an adequate deterrent for vehicle users to not use them. Suggested alternatives - as the Highways Authority are informed of where an accident may be and which lanes to close, suggest turning on any cameras available to catch people. The cameras only need be turned on when the lane is closed.

If caught, increase the fine to £150 and 6 penalty points. Alternatively, for each gantry driven through with a red X give them the standard fine.
